page.title: 16BUILDINGS IN MARLEY HILL
page.content: Many of the older buildings in the area were originally owned by either the Strathmore (Bowes-Lyon) or the Ravensworth Families. {THE SCHOOL HOUSE}situated east of Marley Hill Primary School was until 1947 the headmaster's house.Then it was let out to a family.The present tenant moved there in 1959.The man was a school attendance officer and his wife school caretaker.He is a Tyne and Wear County Councillor and Chairman of the British Airports Authority. {REDLANDS}Situated west of Marley Hill Primary School.It is a 14 roomed house with a large garden, originally built for the Agent(General Manager) of the Bowes Coal Company. An application to turn the house into a Country Club was refused by the Council.The present owner,seeking peace and privacy, moved there in 1975.
